revised_title: Charles Frederick Cross: Pioneering Cellulose Technology and Artificial Silk
tldr: Charles Frederick Cross was a pioneering chemist who devoted his life to cellulose technology. He discovered viscose, which made artificial silk possible and led to the creation of textiles from wood cellulose. Cross's work also contributed to the development of paper manufacturing and viscose films. His achievements in cellulose technology and artificial silk have had a lasting impact on various industries.
